transportAdvice: Dresden has an extensive tram and bus network that connects the city centre with major tourist attractions, making public transit a reliable and affordable option. The historic old town is compact and very walkable, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional snow, typical of central European winter.
Still cold but days begin to lengthen slightly, with occasional frost and overcast skies.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and the first signs of blossom, though cool days persist.
Pleasant spring weather with warming temperatures and occasional showers.
Warm and green with longer days, one of the more enjoyable months to visit.
Warm early summer with comfortable temperatures and occasional afternoon thunderstorms.
The warmest month, with long sunny days and periodic summer storms.
Warm and pleasant, similar to July, with some thunderstorm activity possible.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and beautiful foliage beginning to appear.
Noticeably cooler with frequent overcast skies and autumn colours across the city.
Cold and damp with short days, though the famous Christmas markets begin late in the month.
Cold winter month with a festive atmosphere, as Dresden hosts one of Germany's most celebrated Christmas markets.
